intro: Lithocarpus podocarpus, commonly known as the broad-leaved ironwood, is a member of the Fagaceae family and is native to Southeast Asia. It is a evergreen tree that can grow up to 30 meters tall, characterized by its thick, leathery leaves and dense, hard wood. The plant produces small, cupule-bearing fruits that contain a single seed, typical of the genus Lithocarpus. Its leaves are typically elliptical or ovate, with a glossy upper surface and a pale underside. The plant thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often found in lowland forests and secondary growth areas.
